1. INTRODUCTION
The games between random media and an automaton (games with nature) was proposed by Tsetlin [1], in 1961. In another paper, he and Krylov [2] studied automata games, while Chandrasekaran and Shen [3] analyzed zero sum games with two variable-structure stochastic automata. Those automata used in their model, however, had an optimal behavior in random media under the condition min {p,} ^ \, where {p;} are the probabilities of penalty that are imposed on the automaton. Therefore, if those automata take part in the two automata zero sum games, the following results were obtained regardless of the value of Von Neumann in the game theory.
(1) If the game matrix G has a row of positive (column of negative) elements, then the final expected value of winnings W is the harmonic mean of the ele- ments of this row (column).

4. CONCLUSIONS
Two automata zero sum games between automata proposed by Fu and Li are considered and we obtain the following results.
(1) If the game matrix G satisfies Eq. (1), then the final expected value of winnings, W1, is equal to the value of Von Neumann.
(2) If G' does not satisfy Eq. (1), then W1 is not equal to the value of Von Neumann.
Moreover computer simulations are shown. These simulations indicate satis- factory results.
In connection with two automata zero sum games, some topics (for examples «-automata games, non-zero sum games, etc.) are retained as open problems. Studies of them may be assumed to be one method to find the light for making clear the human behavior and intelligence.
